comment.text: Running fine on bare metal: ASUS PRIME H570M-PLUS with Intel Core i5-11600.

No boot after update from 6.10.6-200.fc40 on a Supermicro X9DRH-7TF with Intel Xeon E5-2670.
On the console it only show the very first line of boot after the grub menu.
Reverting to 6.10.6-200.fc40 boots correctly.
@sandwich @jaskerx Please report a new bug into RH Bugzilla. Remove `rhgb quiet` from the boot command line and capture any error message with a phone. Then link the bugs here. Thanks!
@kparal I already don't have rhgb quiet, I am on the serial console through the BMC of the server. The kernel just never starts or outputs nothing to the console.

Turning the touchpad on/off via Fn + F5 key does not work in this version, which worked in the previous versions.
Otherwise, no problem observed.

        (Workstation Edition)

Working fine after a few days of testing on Lenovo P16s AMD G2 including sound, modern standby, network (7840U + 780M Radeon). Played with the Bluetooth : no issues found with any of my devices. kernel tests ran and uploaded. will test on a Starlite Mk IV later tonight.
Kernel doesn't boot with an AMD 2200G, something about the amdgpu frame buffer. Reverting to 6.10.6 works fine.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-43884 kernel: Bluetooth: MGMT: Add error handling to pair_device() [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-43884 kernel: Bluetooth: MGMT: Add error handling to pair_device() [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-43884 kernel: Bluetooth: MGMT: Add error handling to pair_device()

long_desc.thetext:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

Bluetooth: MGMT: Add error handling to pair_device()

hci_conn_params_add() never checks for a NULL value and could lead to a NULL
pointer dereference causing a crash.

Fixed by adding error handling in the function.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2307840

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

FEDORA-2024-8bda3bcaea (kernel-6.10.7-200.fc40) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 40.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-8bda3bcaea

FEDORA-2024-8bda3bcaea (kernel-6.10.7-200.fc40) has been pushed to the Fedora 40 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
